Class Road

java.lang.Object
  Road
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Road>
public class Road
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Road>

The class Road that can represent the edges of a Graph of Towns. The class must implement Comparable. The class stores references to the two vertices(Town endpoints), the distance between vertices, and a name, and the traditional methods (constructors, getters/setters, toString, etc.), and a compareTo, which compares two Road objects. Since this is a undirected graph, an edge from A to B is equal to an edge from B to A.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object r)
Returns true if each of the ends of the road r is the same as the ends of this road. Remember that a road that goes from point A to point B is the same as a road that goes from point B to point A.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Parameters:
r - road object to compare it to
